Parameters.Conditions: FAO ecological zone: Tropical moist forest; vegetation type: Trees, broadleaf evergreen; stand age: 1; biomass attributes: dbh trees >= 0 cm; soil texture: clay; soil type: Oxisol
Region.Regional.conditions: country: India; state/province/region: Meghalaya; nearest city: Burnihat; geographic coordinates: 26, 91.08333; elevation: 100 m; continent: Asia; Koeppen climate zone: Cwa; mean annual temperature: 25.3 degrees C; annual precipitation: 2200 mm yr-1
Other.Properties: ForC site: Northeast India fallow field chronosequence (ID#: 1337); ForC plot: Forest recovery following slash and burn agriculture. 1 y (ID#: 1690); ForC measurement ID: 10124; Date of Measurement: 1979.8; disturbance type: Cultivation; regrowth type: Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (natural); regrowth year: 1978; variable description: Total live aboveground live biomass.
Full.Technical.Reference: Toky, O. P., & Ramakrishnan, P. S. (1983). Secondary Succession Following Slash and Burn Agriculture in North-Eastern India: I. Biomass, Litterfall and Productivity. The Journal of Ecology, 71(3), 735. doi:10.2307/2259589
Abstract.in.English:
(1) The biomass, productivity and litterfall patterns during a 20-year fallow,
 subsequent to shifting agriculture were studied in north-eastern India.
 (2) The early colonizers varied depending upon the type of vegetation before farming
 and the seed and rhizome sources in the soil, and these depended largely on the
 agricultural practices. Initially, weeds predominated, but a bamboo (Dendrocalamus
 hamiltonii) was an important component of 10-20-year old fallow; later this was
 replaced by shade-intolerant trees.
 (3) The succession was accompanied by increased species diversity, reduced
 dominance, and increased above-ground net primary productivity which reached 1-8 kg
 m-2 year-' in a 20-year old fallow.
 (4) The above-ground biomass increased linearly with age up to 15 kg m-2 in a
 20-year old fallow. The rate of accumulation of biomass increased for 15 years, when it
 was 0.9 kg m-2 year-'; it then declined slightly.
 (5) Litterfall increased with the age of the fallow up to 1.0 kg m-2 year-1 in a 20-year
 old fallow
Comments.from.Data.Provider: original units notes: it is possible the record is not in the original publication's unit.; Data imported from the Global Forest Carbon database (ForC; https://forc-db.github.io/) : Anderson-Teixeira, K. J., M. M. H. Wang, J. C. McGarvey, V. Herrmann, A. J. Tepley, B. P. Bond-Lamberty, and D. S. LeBauer (2018) ForC: a global database of forest carbon stocks and fluxes. Ecology. DOI: 10.1002/ecy.2229.
Data.Provider: ForC Database Team (lead: Kristina Anderson-Teixeira, Smithsonian Institution)
